def_cn: （争论或冲突中的）优势，有利地位
def_en: If a person or organization has the high ground in an argument or dispute, that person or organization has an advantage.

def_cn: 道义上的优势;道德上的制高点
def_en: If you say that someone has taken the moral high ground, you mean that they consider that their policies and actions are morally superior to the policies and actions of their rivals.
